file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 28-21-05-05 - ENGINE SHUT-OFF VALVE - ADJUSTMENT/TEST

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL ENGINE SHUT-OFF VALVE - ADJUSTMENT/TEST EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do the operational check of the engine 1/2 shut-off valves. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT WITH WET ENGINE 1/2 SHUT-OFF VALVES - OP- 28-21-05-700-801-A WINGSTUB ERATIONAL CHECK ACFT WITH DRY ENGINE 1/2 SHUT-OFF VALVES - OP- 28-21-05-700-802-A WINGSTUB ERATIONAL CHECK EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 28-21-05 Page 1 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-21-05-700-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH WET WINGSTUB 2. ENGINE 1/2 SHUT-OFF VALVES - OPERATIONAL CHECK A. General (1) This task is a check of the engine 1/2 shut-off valves for operation. (2) These valves permit the supply/cut-out of fuel to engine 1 and engine 2. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 155 155DZ/155EZ Landing gear bay 156 156DZ/156EZ Landing gear bay D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Closes the circuit breakers, pulls/pushes the fire ex- 1 tinguishing handles, and monitors the warning mes- Cockpit sage on the EICAS display Monitors the operation of the engine 1/2 shut-off 1 Landing gear bay valves I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breakers below and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them: • FIRE EXTG BTL A 1/2. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 28-21-05 Page 2 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL • FIRE EXTG BTL B 1/2. (2) Remove access panels 155DZ/155EZ/156DZ/156EZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100) to get access to the engine 1/2 shut-off valves. (3) Energize the aircraft with an External DC-Power Supply ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). J. Operational Check of the Engine 1/2 Shut-off Valves (Figure 501) SUBTASK 710-002-A (1) Do the check below: (a) Pull the Engine 1/2 Fire Extinguishing Handles on the overhead panel. Result: 1 On the EICAS display, the “E1 FUEL SOV CLSD” and “E2 FUEL SOV CLSD” advisory messages come into view. 2 Make sure that the position indicator, at the engine 1/2 shut-off valves, shows the CLOSED position. (b) Push the Engine 1/2 Fire Extinguishing Handles on the overhead panel. Result: 1 On the EICAS display, the “E1 FUEL SOV CLSD” and “E2 FUEL SOV CLSD” advisory messages go out of view. 2 Make sure that the position indicator, at the engine 1/2 shut-off valves, shows the OPEN position. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Deenergize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (2) Install access panels 155DZ/155EZ/156DZ/156EZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (3) On the circuit breaker panel, close the circuit breakers below and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from them: • FIRE EXTG BTL A 1/2. • FIRE EXTG BTL B 1/2. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 28-21-05 Page 3 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-21-05-700-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH DRY WINGSTUB 3. ENGINE 1/2 SHUT-OFF VALVES - OPERATIONAL CHECK A. General (1) This task is a check of the engine 1/2 shut-off valves for operation. (2) These valves permit the supply/cut-out of fuel to engine 1 and engine 2. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223 223BZ Main instrument panel 225 225ETC Overhead panel 192 192AL/192BR Wing stub D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Closes the circuit breakers, pulls/pushes the fire ex- 1 tinguishing handles, and monitors the warning mes- Cockpit sage on the EICAS display Monitors the operation of the engine 1/2 shut-off 1 Wing stub valves I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breakers below and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them: EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-802-A/500 28-21-05 Page 5 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL • FIRE EXTG BTL A 1/2. • FIRE EXTG BTL B 1/2. (2) Remove access panels 192AL/192BR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100) to get access to the engine 1/2 shut-off valves. (3) Energize the aircraft with an External DC-Power Supply ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). J. Operational Check of the Engine 1/2 Shut-off Valves (Figure 502) SUBTASK 710-003-A (1) Do the check below: (a) Pull the Engine 1/2 Fire Extinguishing Handles on the overhead panel. Result: 1 On the EICAS display, the “E1 FUEL SOV CLSD” and “E2 FUEL SOV CLSD” advisory messages come into view. 2 Make sure that the position indicator, at the engine 1/2 shut-off valves, shows the CLOSED position. (b) Push the Engine 1/2 Fire Extinguishing Handles on the overhead panel. Result: 1 On the EICAS display, the “E1 FUEL SOV CLSD” and “E2 FUEL SOV CLSD” advisory messages go out of view. 2 Make sure that the position indicator, at the engine 1/2 shut-off valves, shows the OPEN position. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) Deenergize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (2) Install access panels 192AL/192BR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (3) On the circuit breaker panel, close the circuit breakers below and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from them: • FIRE EXTG BTL A 1/2. • FIRE EXTG BTL B 1/2.
